text:
Hello,

Is anyone experiencing issues with webfonts from google not loading for drag and drop emails in gmail (<http://mail.google.com|mail.google.com>) ?
The issue seems to have only started in the last day or so,

Thanks

How do I use a contact’s email subscriptions in a Hubl if statement? Let’s say a contact lands on one of my HubSpot landing pages. If that contact has opted into my “Newsletter” email subscription I’d like to do X, but if they’ve unsubscribed or not opted in, I’d like to do Y.

I’m very familiar with how to write HubL if statements. What I don’t know is what I need to type to look at the users email subscriptions.
This isn’t a HubSpot issue. Custom web fonts have never worked in <http://mail.google.com|mail.google.com>.

If you have been seeing custom web fonts loading in <http://mail.google.com|mail.google.com> then you must have that font installed on your computer. There is no other way for them to work.

See the web font support list here:
<https://www.caniemail.com/features/css-at-font-face/>
For anyone interested, the missing requirement was having the transactional email software add-on.
Unfortunately I don’t have an answer for you. But would overwriting that class with your own CSS suffice?
